name: Road or highway drainage outfalls
functionStatement: Quantity + quality of inflow (tributaries, ditches, and pipes) does not provide harmful peaks or pollution, and supports diverse habitat conditions.
descriptionMarkdown: Runoff is minimal or well-managed, causing no significant direct inflows or pollutant pulses.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Count road or highway drainage outfalls per 100 m and note erosion or sediment plumes. Corroborate with available transportation layers if present.

levels.label: Optimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: 0-1 outfall per 100 m, and no noticeable discharge effects.

levels.label: Suboptimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: 2-3 outfalls per 100 m, with some unmitigated runoff but partial buffering.

levels.label: Marginal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: 4-5 outfalls per 100 m, with noticeable sediment or pollutant inputs.

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: More than 5 outfalls per 100 m, or major highway drains with concentrated discharge.

references: DOT drainage or as-built plans (where available)
